intro: Phacocapnos, commonly known as the desert lily, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plants are characterized by their succulent, often hairy leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Phacocapnos species are typically perennial herbs that store water in their thick stems and leaves, allowing them to survive in dry environments. They play an important role in stabilizing desert soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
